example.text: Learn more about what my office has been up to this week Dear , On Monday night, I took to the floor of the House of Representatives to speak out against the frightening assault on democracy which recently took place in the Tennessee State Legislature. Our children are being murdered in their classrooms , and rather than work on solutions to prevent these senseless tragedies, Tennessee lawmakers opted to expel their colleagues who are fighting for change.

In a mall, in a grocery store, in a nightclub, in a school, in a place of worship...the list goes on. We don’t have to live this way. Let’s find common-ground in common-sense solutions. #BanAssaultWeapons [[user]] [[url]]

Pictured above: excerpt from an Atlanta Journal Constitution piece discussing $35 monthly cap on insulin for Medicare enrollees Last weekend, I announced my fourth annual Valentines for Veterans program. I am thrilled by the enthusiasm already shown by our community .

In a mall, in a grocery store, in a nightclub, in a school, in a place of worship...the list goes on. We don’t have to live this way. Let’s find common-ground in common-sense solutions. #BanAssaultWeapons [[user]] [[url]]

Pictured above: Rep. McBath tours Georgia Gwinnett College Finally, I wrapped up the week by meeting with the Japanese Consul General of Atlanta. Hundreds of Japanese businesses have invested over $10 billion in our state, and I look forward to continuing to foster friendship and cooperation between our two nations.

Like so many women in America, I struggled to get pregnant. My son, Jordan, was a blessing for my family. Mothers and infants across this country rely on the support #WIC provides, and our bill improves the quality of formula contracts available. [[url]]
